00001 <h2>The missing commandline tool for batteries</h2>
00002 <p>
00003         batterystat is a commandline tool that you can use to get information on the status of your batteries.
00004 </p>
00005 <p class="centered">
00006         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/batterystat/batterystat-screenshot.png"
00007                 alt="Output of batterystat" />
00008 </p>
00009 <p>
00010         Based on the same code as the powerful application
00011         <a href="/software/macosx/minibatterylogger.html">MiniBatteryLogger</a>,
00012         it is an essential tool for system administrators and bash scripters.
00013 </p>
00014 <p>
00015         batterystat requires Mac OS X 10.3.9 &ldquo;Panther&rdquo; or later.
00016         batterystat is a Universal Binary application; you can use it under both PowerPC and Intel Macs.
00017 </p>
00018 <p>
00019         Suggestions for improvements, bug reports and comments are welcome.
00020 </p>
